q: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
h:
“Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Confidence is like a dragon where, for every head cut off, two more heads grow back.
h:
“Confidence is like a dragon where, for every head cut off, two more heads grow back.” —
Criss Jami

q: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
h:
“Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love. ” —
Lao Tzu

q: Confidence is contagious. So is lack of confidence.
h:
“Confidence is contagious. So is lack of confidence.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: Without the confidence, nothing can be accomplished.
h:
“Without the confidence, nothing can be accomplished.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
h:
“Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence. ” —
George Washington

q: You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
h:
“You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Confidence is consistency of thinking about what is possible and how to make it possible.
h:
“Confidence is consistency of thinking about what is possible and how to make it possible.” —
John Eliot

q: Education breeds confidence. Confidence breeds hope. Hope breeds peace.
h:
“Education breeds confidence. Confidence breeds hope. Hope breeds peace.” —
Confucius

q: Confidence comes not from always being right but not fearing to be wrong.
h:
“Confidence comes not from always being right but not fearing to be wrong.” —
Unknown

q: Confidence is what you have before you understand the problem.
h:
“Confidence is what you have before you understand the problem.” —
Woody Allen

q: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
h:
“Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.” —
Helen Keller

q: Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence
h:
“Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: Confidence is not a guarantee of success, but a pattern of thinking that will improve your likelihood of success, a tenacious search for ways to make things work.
h:
“Confidence is not a guarantee of success, but a pattern of thinking that will improve your likelihood of success, a tenacious search for ways to make things work.” —
John Eliot
